title: Quark Expeditions announce Antarctic cruises with flights over Drake Passage
text:
Quark Expeditions announce Antarctic cruises with flights over Drake Passage Quark Expeditions announce Antarctic cruises with flights over Drake Passage POLAR cruise company Quark Expeditions has announced nine new Antarctica fly and cruise packages for 2016 and 2017. PUBLISHED: 08:42, Fri, Jul 24, 2015 | UPDATED: 08:52, Fri, Jul 24, 2015 GETTY SEE: South Georgia's King Penguin rookeries and historic whaling stations 
They include some aimed at the time-poor, such as an eight-day Antarctic Express: Fly The Drake cruise with "no Drake Passage crossings required", from £7,100 per person, two sharing. 
This avoids sailing through the notoriously choppy Drake's Passage and gives time-poor passengers more opportunities to take part in activities. 
But for those wanting a longer experience there is the 16-day South Georgia and Antarctic Peninsula: Penguin Safari. 
This Antarctic wildlife extravaganza includes visits to South Georgia's King Penguin rookeries, historic whaling stations and the final resting place of explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton. The wildlife encounters, and those once-in-a-lifetime photography opportunities are unparalleled, as is the rich history of exploration of these regions Andrew White, Quark Expeditions President 
Prices start from £10,500 per person based on a twin cabin. 
"South Georgia and area continue to be a fascinating draw for adventure travellers in search of an authentic, and diverse expedition experience," said Andrew White, Quark Expeditions President. 
"The wildlife encounters, and those once-in-a-lifetime photography opportunities are unparalleled, as is the rich history of exploration of these regions. 
"We are thrilled to be able to provide our passengers with more expedition options into such a remote, extraordinary part of the world." 
South Georgia, known as the "Galapagos of the Poles", is home to 30 million birds that nest and raise their young on the island. 
This includes 30 bird species, and there are also elephant, leopard and fur seals living there. 
One of the excursions on Quark Expeditions itineraries is to visit the graveside of Sir Ernest Shackleton, at the Grytviken Whaling Church cemetery. 
A Scientists In Residence programme operated by Quark Expeditions provides scientists with a base for their research and conservation work, and these experts deliver lectures and take part in informal talks with passengers. 
This is on top of other lectures in ornithology, marine biology, penguinology and Polar history from onboard experts and expedition leaders. 
Quark Expeditions is offering up to 25 per cent discounts on Antarctic 2016/17 bookings made by September 30, 2015. 
Solo travellers on the Ocean Endeavour can also benefit from no single supplement on select cabins. 
For more information visit quarkexpeditions.com or call 0808 120 2333. Related articles
